item.title: Private Sanctuary 246 – Harrow Crunch
item.dc:creator: Ryan Costello
item.description: Harrow month is coming to a close, but a full analysis of all things Harrow would not be complete without going into the various rules that exist to help you bring a harrow-themed character to life. With the Everyman Gamer Alex Augunas. Listen Now! SHOW NOTES SPONSORS Chimera Café and Games Check out Pathfinder Player’s […]
item.content:encoded:
Harrow month is coming to a close, but a full analysis of all things Harrow would not be complete without going into the various rules that exist to help you bring a harrow-themed character to life. With the Everyman Gamer Alex Augunas.

Listen Now!

SHOW NOTES

SPONSORS

Chimera Café and Games

Check out Pathfinder Player’s Companion – The Harrow Handbook, the book that basically inspired this episode, and Harrow month.

Read up on the Harrow on the Pathfinder Wiki.

Harrow Options

o   Original Options

  • Harrow Deck (Equipment) (http://www.archivesofnethys.com/EquipmentMiscDisplay.aspx?ItemName=Harrow%20deck) 100 gp gets you, actually, nothing on its own. There’s no rules text beyond its cost and weight (which is nothing). Inner Sea World Guide, Ultimate Equipment, various;
  • Harrowed (Feat) (http://www.archivesofnethys.com/FeatDisplay.aspx?ItemName=Harrowed) Harrowed +1 bonus on all Will saves made to resist enchantment effects, 1/day draw a card, 1/day gain +2 on a roll related to card’s suit. (Inner Sea World Guide)
  • Harrower (prestige class) http://www.archivesofnethys.com/PrestigeClassesDisplay.aspx?ItemName=Harrower ½ BAB, full casting PrC with tonnes of class features, such as: Blessing of the Harrow (grant all allies +1 bonus to certain rolls based on the results of a special harrowing); and Harrow Casting (draw three cards when casting to potentially gain a benefit) (Inner Sea World Guide);
  • Harrowing (spell) http://www.archivesofnethys.com/SpellDisplay.aspx?ItemName=Harrowing Use a Harrow deck to tell a fortune, based on their alignment. (Inner Sea World Guide)

Gambit Style!

  1. Deadly Dealer (feat) http://www.archivesofnethys.com/FeatDisplay.aspx?ItemName=Deadly%20Dealer Throw a card as a dart, throw a Harrow card as a masterwork dart. (The Harrow Handbook, Varisia, Birthplace of Legends)

Archetypes

  1. Card Caster (magus archetype) http://www.archivesofnethys.com/ArchetypeDisplay.aspx?FixedName=Card%20Caster Gain magus abilities when using Harrow Deck as a deck of darts. (The Harrow Handbook)
  2. Cartomancer (witch archetype) http://www.archivesofnethys.com/ArchetypeDisplay.aspx?FixedName=Cartomancer Use a Harrow deck as a traditional witch uses a familiar. (The Harrow Handbook)
  3. Harrow Warden (monk archetype) http://www.archivesofnethys.com/ArchetypeDisplay.aspx?FixedName=Harrow%20Warden Esoteric class features mostly tie into Harrow thematically. (The Harrow Handbook)
  4. Sczarni Swindler (rogue archetype) http://www.archivesofnethys.com/ArchetypeDisplay.aspx?FixedName=Sczarni%20Swindler Fake fortune teller. (The Harrow Handbook)
  5. Story Summoner (summoner archetype) http://www.archivesofnethys.com/ArchetypeDisplay.aspx?FixedName=Story%20Summoner Reads Harrow to tell stories that summon creatures. (The Harrow Handbook)
  6. Suit Seeker (inquisitor archetype) http://www.archivesofnethys.com/ArchetypeDisplay.aspx?FixedName=Suit%20Seeker Inquisitor of luck that leaves judgment to chance. (The Harrow Handbook)

 

Other Options

  • Harrow Mat (equipment) (http://www.archivesofnethys.com/EquipmentMiscDisplay.aspx?ItemName=Harrow%20mat) +4 on Bluff or Diplomacy (Harrow Handbook)
  • Deck of Slivering Fate (Magic Item) (http://www.archivesofnethys.com/MagicWeaponsDisplay.aspx?ItemName=Deck%20of%20Slivering%20Fate) 13,000 gp +1 limningUE harrow deck that deals slashing damage and doubles the arcane strike bonus when combined with Deadly Dealer (Harrow Handbook)
  • Fortunate (Magic trait) http://www.archivesofnethys.com/TraitDisplay.aspx?ItemName=Fortunate (Quests and Campaigns). 1/day, when randomizing an effect, pick twice and choose the result.
  • Harrow Born (race trait) http://www.archivesofnethys.com/TraitDisplay.aspx?ItemName=Harrow%20Born Start play with a harrow deck, +1 initiative. (Humans of Golarion)

Harrow Chosen (race trait) http://www.archivesofnethys.com/TraitDisplay.aspx?ItemName=Harrow%20Chosen Begin play with a harrow deck. +2 CL for divination spells. 2/week can augury (Varisia, Birthplace of Legends)

Like The Private Sanctuary on Facebook.

Visit DriveThru RPG for all your RPG PDF needs.

This podcast is a member of RPG Podcasts.

item.title: Know Direction 90 – Harrowing the Future
item.dc:creator: Ryan Costello
item.description: No, we’re not distressed about what lies ahead for Paizo or Pathfinder. August is Harrow month at knowdirectionpodcast.com, and we kick it off by predicting the future. Kickstarter backer Matt Harris asks: Where do you guys see Pathfinder 5 years down the road? Do you still think it will be the #1 RPG? Will it still […]
item.content:encoded:
No, we’re not distressed about what lies ahead for Paizo or Pathfinder. August is Harrow month at knowdirectionpodcast.com, and we kick it off by predicting the future. Kickstarter backer Matt Harris asks:

Where do you guys see Pathfinder 5 years down the road? Do you still think it will be the #1 RPG? Will it still be expanding the RPG universe? Or will it be contracting?

Listen Now!

SHOW NOTES

SPONSORS

Café Chimera Games

 

NEWS

  • Advanced Class Guide Adventure Path?
    http://paizo.com/paizo/blog/v5748dyo5lgcs?A-Tale-of-Two-Covers
  • Shardra Geltl, iconic Shaman is transgender, 99% of internet cool with it or politely quiet.
    http://paizo.com/paizo/blog/v5748dyo5lgcn?Meet-the-Iconics-Shardra-Geltl
  • Squealy Nord! More Minimates!
    http://paizo.com/paizo/blog/v5748dyo5lgcy?Friday-Publisher-Preview-Feeling-Iconic
  • More Mini-Mates Revealed (Same link as above)
    http://wesschneider.tumblr.com/post/93983780281/gencon-is-coming-up-quickly-and-i-was-wondering-if-the
    http://www.enworld.org/forum/content.php?1795-Meet-PATHFINDER-s-First-Transgender-Iconic-Character-plus-the-Dogslicer-Ale-Goblin-Minimate!#.U-LS3GNqb8s
  • GenCon cometh!
    August 14-17
    http://gencon.com/

 

READ MAGIC

  • Harrow Handbook http://paizo.com/products/btpy95zm?Pathfinder-Player-Companion-The-Harrow-Handbook
    • New Harrow Deck http://paizo.com/products/btpy938e?Pathfinder-Cards-Deluxe-Harrow-Deck

item.title: Private Sanctuary 245 – Harrow Flavour
item.dc:creator: Ryan Costello
item.description: Harrow month continues with a look at what makes Harrow such a compelling game element. Harrowing can be minimized as something that happens on Golarion. More specifically, a small subsection of Varisians use Harrow decks to tell fortunes and make money. And yet, the recent Pathfinder Player Companion – The Harrow Handbook proves that a […]
item.content:encoded:
Harrow month continues with a look at what makes Harrow such a compelling game element.

Harrowing can be minimized as something that happens on Golarion. More specifically, a small subsection of Varisians use Harrow decks to tell fortunes and make money. And yet, the recent Pathfinder Player Companion – The Harrow Handbook proves that a narrow topic can inspire a wide range of ideas.

Listen Now!

SHOW NOTES

SPONSORS

Chimera Café and Games

Check out Paizo’s new Deluxe Harrow Deck.

Read up on the Harrow on the Pathfinder Wiki.

item.content:encoded:

Listen now!

Warning: No language warning on this one, but almost as bad: John Compton is an emphatic individual, and drives home his points by banging his fist on the table. The same table our recorders are on. To make you feel better, every time your hear a banging in your ears, think to yourself “Compton smash!”

item.title: Private Sanctuary 244 – Inclusive GMing
item.dc:creator: Ryan Costello
item.description: It may seem like in every GMing episode, we pile another responsibility on the shoulders of our overburdened Game Masters. This episode might be the heaviest one yet. we talk about a GM’s social responsibility, with special guest co-host Tracy Hurley. GMs have a lot of responsibility Listen Now! SHOW NOTES SPONSORS Chimera Café and […]
item.content:encoded:
It may seem like in every GMing episode, we pile another responsibility on the shoulders of our overburdened Game Masters. This episode might be the heaviest one yet. we talk about a GM’s social responsibility, with special guest co-host Tracy Hurley.

GMs have a lot of responsibility

Listen Now!

SHOW NOTES

SPONSORS

Chimera Café and Games

 

When last we welcomed Tracy Hurley into the Private Sanctuary, it was based on her role as co-host of The Tome Show, a D&D podcast, to talk about skill challenges in Private Sanctuary 189. Today, we invite her on as blogger Sarah Darkmagic and advocate of equality in gaming. (http://www.sarahdarkmagic.com/)

Inclusivity has been a hot topic lately in gaming and broader geek hobbies, and many tabletop RPG companies have been taking aggressively pro-inclusive steps.

Paizo discussed it at length in their recent Diversity In Gaming seminar at PaizoCon and have been largely praised for supporting transgender fan Distracted Elf through their socially difficult coming out by way of Pathfinder products featuring transgender characters. And it’s heartening to see the predominantly positive response writer Crystal Frasier received for the new iconic shaman, Shardra Geltl.

WotC also took a bold step towards supporting inclusivity by wording the sex section of the new D&D rulebook to encourage playing across gender, and exploring homosexual, transgender, and asexual character ideas. There have been some debates about the wording but overall, WotC has been credited for their good intentions.

However, Tracy went deeper into the product and found fair gender representation to be lacking. What could a publisher of printed adventures, or a GM running a home game, do to create a more inclusive atmosphere?

 

Talking points:

  • Hi Tracy!
  • Why is inclusivity important?
    • Commentary;
  • Word choice and being too PC;
    • D&D’s influence;
  • Where did Lost Mines of Phandelver go wrong?
  • Challenges of representation;
  • Sexist plot versus sexist plotting;
    • Trigger plots/creatures;
  • Accommodating your players’ ideas, addressing your players’ intolerance.

 

Shout Outs:

  • SarahDarkmagic.com
  • GamingAsWomen

 

Like The Private Sanctuary on Facebook.

Visit DriveThru RPG for all your RPG PDF needs.

This podcast is a member of RPG Podcasts.

item.title: Know Direction 88 – PaizoCon-cluded
item.dc:creator: Ryan Costello
item.description: PaizoCon 2014 came and went. Ryan shares the big news and tells Perram about his new favourite PaizoCon memories. Listen Now! SHOW NOTES SPONSORS Café Chimera Games SPECIAL: 2014’s PaizoCon-clusion! What happened at the most Pathfinder-focused event of the year? Pathfinder News No product catalog this year, but we found out the following at the […]
item.content:encoded:
PaizoCon 2014 came and went. Ryan shares the big news and tells Perram about his new favourite PaizoCon memories.

Listen Now!

SHOW NOTES

SPONSORS

Café Chimera Games

SPECIAL:
2014’s PaizoCon-clusion!
What happened at the most Pathfinder-focused event of the year?

Pathfinder News
No product catalog this year, but we found out the following at the banquet:

·         RPG:
o   Pathfinder Unchained (Spring 2015)
§  Pathfinder was made with one eye on the 3.5 rear view mirror. How would it be different if the game was designed today?
§  If the designers weren’t restricted by synergy, tradition, or logic, what could they do to the Pathfinder RPG rules?
§  New takes on four of the games problem classes.
o   Advanced Class Guide
§  Every new class will receive 4 pages of options and archetypes;
§  Each of the game’s existing class will receive 1 page of options and archetypes;
§ Jason Bulmahn said the total number of classes will be 30 after the ACG, but the actual number is 29 not counting alternate classes and 32 counting alternate classes (including the antipaladin), so it’s not known if the ninja and samurai will get their own pages or not.
o   Monster Codex 
§  Not much news, just more art. Looks pretty.
o   Strategy Guide
§  Delayed for numerous reasons, such as layout.

·         AP: Giant Slayer
o   You know who has it coming? Giants.
o   If the sample art is to be believed, there will be taiga giants, stone giants, and frost giants;
o   Sean K Reynolds writing?

·         Licensing
o   Pathfinder Minimates
§  Four-pack due in October;
§  12 exclusive miniatures will be available all over GenCon (including KonKrud, a Licktoad goblin, and Razmiri priest), but they will be challenging to obtain.
o   Pathfinder Comics
§  Dark Waters Rising vol 2
§  Goblins hardcover TPB
o   Syrinscape:
§  RotRL is out now! And you can get a month free! And Know Direction listeners can look forward to a treat! o   Campaign Coins is minting a Sihedron medallion.

·         Adventure Card Game
o   Adventure Card Game is huge!
o   Skull & Shackles (due this August) was demoed round the clock;
o   Next set, Wrath of the Righteous, introduces Mythic card;
o   Tanis O’Connor talks Pathfinder Society – Adventure Card Guild new organized play program features:
§  Season 0: Season of the Shackles (experimental season)
§  Weekly (weekly!) PFS:ACG scenarios (PDFs) released to VOs & participating retailers;
§  New class decks: bard, cleric, fighter, ranger, rogue, sorcerer, wizard.

·         Pathfinder Online
o   Soon…
·         Next Year’s PaizoCon: Friday, May 22nd – Memorial Day/Victoria Day, Monday, May 25th, 2015, at a new venue, the Doubletree by Hilton.

PaizoCon Thoughts:
·         Volunteer(s) of the Year: England VCs Dave Harrison and Rob Silk
·         Balancing con goals;
·         Spoiler-free 6-00 Legacy of the Stonelords thoughts:
o   Justin Riddler’s whole new level of buff tracking (with Ryan Scheppler);
·         Middling trivia;
·         Other highlights:

SHOUT OUTS
Syrinscape;
Ponyfinder (Pathfinder editor-in-chief approved!)
Comic Bento
Boss Fight Studio’s Vitruvian H.A.C.K.S. Action Figures

Like Know Direction on Facebook, and check out the Know Direction YouTube channel.

This podcast is a member of RPG Podcasts.

item.title: PaizoCon 2014 Special 012 – Adventure Design 101
item.dc:creator: Ryan Costello
item.description: An array of adventure design and development stars sits down to dish the basics of bringing out the best in your adventures, be they for home games or freelance. Featuring Logan Bonner, James Jacobs, Patrick Renie, Rob McCreary, and Owen KC Stephens. Listen now!
item.content:encoded:
An array of adventure design and development stars sits down to dish the basics of bringing out the best in your adventures, be they for home games or freelance. Featuring Logan Bonner, James Jacobs, Patrick Renie, Rob McCreary, and Owen KC Stephens.

Listen now!

item.title: Private Sanctuary 243 – The Gunslinger
item.dc:creator: Ryan Costello
item.description: Find out all about the class that brings a gun to a sword-and-sorcery fight, the gunslinger! Listen now! Sponsor Café Chimera Games Show Notes Book: Ultimate Combat Concept: A steel-toting, rough-riding, quick-drawing son of a gun. (Lirianne) Context: Westerns: The Batman Test Our gunslingers: None. Ever. Mechanics: Full BAB / D10 HD; 4 + Int skill points, […]
item.content:encoded:
Find out all about the class that brings a gun to a sword-and-sorcery fight, the gunslinger!

Listen now!

Sponsor

Café Chimera Games

Show Notes

Book: Ultimate Combat

Concept: A steel-toting, rough-riding, quick-drawing son of a gun. (Lirianne)

Context:

  • Westerns:
  • The Batman Test
  • Our gunslingers: None. Ever.

Mechanics:

  • Full BAB / D10 HD;
  • 4 + Int skill points, Acrobatics (Dex), Bluff (Cha), Climb (Str), Craft (Int), Handle Animal (Cha), Heal (Wis), Intimidate (Cha), Knowledge (engineering) (Int), Knowledge (local) (Int), Perception (Wis), Profession (Wis), Ride (Dex), Sleight of Hand (Dex), Survival (Wis), and Swim (Str).
  • simple, martial weapons, all firearms, light armor;
  • Class features:
  • 1st Gunsmith: Free blunderbuss, musket or pistol that you can’t jam, Gunsmithing feat.
  • 1st Deeds: Gain deeds of your level or lower, spend grit to do something amazing.

o    1st, 3rd, and every fourth level thereafter.

  • 1st Grit: Replenishing pointes-based resource equal to the gunslinger’s Wisdom mod. Regained by confirming a critical hit or dropping a target with a gun.
  • 2nd Nimble: +1 dodge AC wearing light or no armor. +1 every four levels beyond 2nd.
  • 4th Bonus combat or grit feat every fourth level.
  • 5th Gun Training: Pick a type of gun. Add Dex mod on damage rolls with that type of gun. Every four levels thereafter pick another type of firearm.
  • 20th True Grit: Two grit-spending deeds costs 1 less grit point.

Deeds:

  • Deadeye (1st): Target touch AC, spend 1 grit per range increment beyond first.
  • Gunslinger’s Dodge (1st): When trageted with a ranged attack, spend 1 grit to move 5 feet as an immediate action +2 bonus to AC
  • Quick Clear (1st): As a standard action, fix a broken firearm, spend 1 grit to quick clear as a move action.
  • Gunslinger Initiative (3rd): +2 initiative, can draw a firearm as part of the initiative check if she has the Quick Draw feat.
  • Pistol-Whip (3rd): Spend 1 grit to melee attack with firearm as a standard action.
  • Utility Shot (3rd): Replace an attack with one of the following:
  •             Blast Lock: Disable lock by shooting it;
  •             Scoot Unattended Object: Move object with bullets;
  •             Stop Bleeding: Cauterize wound.
  • Dead Shot (7th) Full-round action to fire all shots at a target, dealing additional damage. Good for overcoming DR.
  • Startling Shot (7th): Turn a hit into a miss to render target flatfooted.
  • Targeting (7th) Full-round action to target body parts.
  • Bleeding Wound (11th): Spend 1 grit to cause bleed, or 2 grit to cause ability score bleed.
  • Expert Loading (11th): Misfiring a broken gun doesn’t blow it up.
  • Lightning Reload (11th) Reload a single barrel of a one-handed or two-handed firearm as a swift action.
  • Evasive (15th): Evasion, uncanny dodge, and improved uncanny dodge.
  • Menacing Shot (15th) Spend 1 grit point to target an area of effect.
  • Slinger’s Luck (15th): Spend grit to reroll a saving throw or a skill check.
  • Cheat Death (19th): Spend all remaining grit to be reduced to 1 hp instead of 0 or below.
  • Death’s Shot (19th): Spend 1 grit to turn a crit into a save or die.
  • Stunning Shot (19th): Spend 2 grit points to stun a hit creature for 1 round.

 

Ability Scores: Dex, Wis.

Best Race: Human, dwarf, elf, half-elf, half-orc, halfling.

Roles: Ranged damage.

Archetypes: Gun Scavenger (shoots scrap), Gun Tank (heavily armoured), Gunner Squire (supports a knight), Musket Master (obvious), Mysterious Stranger (swap Cha for Wis), Pistolero (pistle specialist), Siege Gunner (cannons specialist), Wyrm Sniper (dragon hunter)

Roleplaying Keywords: Cowboy

item.title: PaizoCon 2014 Special 011 – Horror & Gaming
item.dc:creator: Ryan Costello
item.description: Good news, horror fans! This seminar is a continuation of last year’s Horror in RPGs seminar. Find out more of how to up the scare in your horror game with James Jacobs, Ryan Macklin, and F. Wesley Schneider. Listen now! Warning: Language, disturbing ideas, and revelations about what Twitter feeds Ryan Macklin follows.
item.content:encoded:
Good news, horror fans! This seminar is a continuation of last year’s Horror in RPGs seminar. Find out more of how to up the scare in your horror game with James Jacobs, Ryan Macklin, and F. Wesley Schneider.

Listen now!

Warning: Language, disturbing ideas, and revelations about what Twitter feeds Ryan Macklin follows.

item.title: PaizoCon 2014 Special 010 – Diversity in Gaming
item.dc:creator: Ryan Costello
item.description: Judy Bauer, James L. Sutter, Crystal Frasier and F. Wesley “Another *bleet*ing White Person” Schneider discuss the importance and challenges of ensuring Paizo creates ever more inclusive products, while very much illustrating that something can be inclusive and wildly entertaining. Listen now! The Language Is Worth It Warning: This may be the most rated W.E.S. […]
item.content:encoded:
Judy Bauer, James L. Sutter, Crystal Frasier and F. Wesley  “Another *bleet*ing White Person” Schneider discuss the importance and challenges of ensuring Paizo creates ever more inclusive products, while very much illustrating that something can be inclusive and wildly entertaining.

Listen now!

The Language Is Worth It Warning: This may be the most rated W.E.S. podcast we will ever release, but it was well worth our Censor Goat’s time bleeting out all the swears to maintain our all-ages status. Not only are the hosts and audience palpably having a great time, but the conversation is smart and insightful, never diverting from the topic of diversity.

item.title: PaizoCon 2014 Special 009 – Secrets of TSR
item.dc:creator: Ryan Costello
item.description: Veterans of the fantasy RPG industry, Wolfgang Baur, Pierce Watters, and Frank Mentzer tell stories you won’t likely hear about in formal podcast or blog interviews. This are sincere reminiscing of the good times, the trials, and the strangeness of the early days of TSR. Listen now! Notice: We were a bit late to this […]
item.content:encoded:
Veterans of the fantasy RPG industry, Wolfgang Baur, Pierce Watters, and Frank Mentzer tell stories you won’t likely hear about in formal podcast or blog interviews. This are sincere reminiscing of the good times, the trials, and the strangeness of the early days of TSR.

Listen now!
Notice: We were a bit late to this one, or the guys started early, so the recording begins with the end of a story by Wolfgang Baur about a car catching fire at a hospital.
